isis.stitle: 7 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS FULLER SERIES - REASSEMBLE - MAINSHAFT

step1.para: Install mainshaft in vise equipped with wood or brass jaws, front of mainshaft facing down ( Figure 112). Make sure that roll pin is in place. If previously removed, install snap rings in the hubs of the mainshaft gears.

figure.caption: Figure 112. Install Mainshaft in Vise

step1.para: Install white color-coded tolerance washer on the mainshaft in 4th speed position, flat side of the washer facing up. Rotate the washer to align the splines and install the key to lock the washer in position ( Figure 113).

figure.caption: Figure 113. Install Tolerance Washer and Rotate

step1.para: Install the spacer, with the shoulder of the spacer facing up, against the tolerance washer ( Figure 114).

figure.caption: Figure 114. Install Spacer Against Tolerance Washer

step1.para: Install 4th speed gear on the spacer with clutching teeth facing down ( Figure 115).

figure.caption: Figure 115. Install 4th Speed Gear on Spacer

step1.para: Install 3rd speed gear on the 4th speed gear with the clutching teeth facing up ( Figure 116).
Install the spacer, shoulder facing down, into 3rd speed gear ( Figure 117).

figure.caption: Figure 116. Install 3rd Speed Gear on 4th Speed Gear
Figure 117. Install Spacer into 3rd Speed Gear

step1.para: Remove the key ( Figure 118). Install tolerance washer with the flat side against the spacer.

figure.caption: Figure 118. Remove Key

step1.para: Rotate the tolerance washer 1/2 spline ( Figure 119) and re-install the key (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 119. Rotate Tolerance Washer and Re-install Key

step1.para: Insert two large screwdrivers between 3rd and 4th speed gears ( Figure 120). Apply slight downward pressure on the screwdriver handles to spread gears evenly. Making certain gear hubs are parallel, insert feeler gauge between gear hubs. Correct axial clearance is .005 to .012 inch. If clearance is less than the minimum .005 inch tolerance, the tolerance washer in 3rd speed gear should be replaced by a thinner washer. If clearance checked is larger than the maximum .012 inch tolerance, a thicker tolerance washer should be installed in 3rd speed gear.

figure.caption: Figure 120. Insert Screwdrivers Between 3rd and 4th Speed Gears

step1.para: Install 2nd and 3rd speed sliding clutch ( Figure 121), aligning the missing internal spline of the sliding clutch with key (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 121. Install 2nd and 3rd Speed Sliding Clutch

step1.para: Remove the key and install the white color-coded tolerance washer in 2nd speed position with the flat side of the washer facing up ( Figure 122). Rotate washer 1/2 spline and re-install the key.

figure.caption: Figure 122. Install Tolerance Washer in 2nd Speed Position

step1.para: Install the spacer, with shoulder side up, against the tolerance washer ( Figure 123).

figure.caption: Figure 123. Install Spacer Against Tolerance Washer

step1.para: Temporarily install the snap ring in 2nd speed gear ( inset, Figure 124). Install the gear, clutching teeth facing down. Engage clutching teeth of gear with external splines of the spacer.

figure.caption: Figure 124. Temporarily Install Snap Ring in 2nd Speed Gear and Install Gear

step1.para: Install the spacer against the back of 2nd speed gear ( Figure 125).

figure.caption: Figure 125. Install Spacer Against Back of 2nd Speed Gear

step1.para: Install 1st speed gear with clutching teeth facing up, against the spacer ( Figure 126).

figure.caption: Figure 126. Install 1st Speed Gear

step1.para: Install the spacer, shoulder side facing down, into 1st speed gear ( Figure 127).

figure.caption: Figure 127. Install Spacer into 1st Speed Gear

step1.para: Install the tolerance washer with the flat side toward the spacer ( Figure 128).

figure.caption: Figure 128. Install Tolerance Washer

step1.para: Rotate washer 1/2 spline ( Figure 129) and re-install the key (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 129. Rotate Washer and Re-install key

step1.para: Use two wood blocks and two large screwdrivers to evenly spread 1st and 2nd speed gear ( Figure 130). Check clearance with a feeler gauge between spacer and 1st speed gear. Correct clearance is .005 to .012 inch. If it is necessary to adjust clearance, change tolerance washer in 1st gear.

figure.caption: Figure 130. Evenly Spread 1st and 2nd Speed Gear

step1.para: Remove the key and install the white color-coded tolerance washer, flat side facing up, in reverse speed position ( Figure 131). Re-install the key.

figure.caption: Figure 131. Install Tolerance Washer in Reverse Speed Position

step1.para: Install spacer, shoulder side facing up, against the tolerance washer ( Figure 132).

figure.caption: Figure 132. Install Spacer Against Tolerance Washer

step1.para: Install the reverse gear, clutching teeth facing down ( Figure 133). Engage clutching teeth of the gear with the external splines of the spacer.

figure.caption: Figure 133. Install Reverse Gear

step1.para: Install the washer, with tapered side facing up, against the reverse gear ( Figure 134).

figure.caption: Figure 134. Install Washer Against Reverse Gear

step1.para: Apply downward pressure against the spacer and check clearance between the spacer and reverse gear with the feeler gauge ( Figure 135). Correct clearance is .005 to .012 inch. If it is necessary to adjust clearance, change the tolerance washer in reverse gear.

figure.caption: Figure 135. Check Clearance Between Spacer and Reverse Gear

step1.para: Remove the spacer, reverse gear, externally splined spacer, key, tolerance washer, 1st speed gear tolerance washer, 1st speed gear spacer, 1st speed gear, 1st and 2nd gear spacer, 2nd speed gear and its externally splined spacer from the mainshaft ( Figure 136). Keep related spacers and tolerance washers with the gears. Do not mix these parts after you have set axial clearance between the gears.

figure.caption: Figure 136. Remove Reverse, 1st Speed and 2nd Speed Gears, Spacers and Tolerance Washers

step1.para: Remove the mainshaft assembly from the vise. Re-install in the vise with the front of the mainshaft facing up. Install 4th-5th speed sliding clutch, aligning the missing internal spline of the sliding clutch with the key in the mainshaft ( Figure 137).

figure.caption: Figure 137. Install 4th-5th Speed Sliding Clutch

step1.para: Install 5th gear spacer, flat side facing up ( Figure 138).

figure.caption: Figure 138. Install 5th Gear Spacer

step1.para: Install 5th speed gear with clutching teeth facing down ( Figure 139). Engage clutching teeth of the gear with the external splines of the spacer.

figure.caption: Figure 139. Install 5th Speed Gear

step1.para: Install 6th speed gear, with the clutching teeth facing up, against the 5th speed gear ( Figure 140).

figure.caption: Figure 140. Install 6th Speed Gear Against 5th Speed Gear

step1.para: Install the spacer in 6th speed gear ( Figure 141).

figure.caption: Figure 141. Install Spacer in 6th Speed Gear

step1.para: Install the tolerance washer, with the flat side facing down, against the spacer ( Figure 142). Rotate the washer to align the square notch in the washer with the keyway in the mainshaft and install the short key (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 142. Install Tolerance Washer Against Spacer

step1.para: Check clearance ( Figure 143) and make adjustments if necessary between 5th and 6th speed gears (in the same manner as performed in Step 9).

figure.caption: Figure 143. Check Clearance

step1.para: Install 6th and 7th speed sliding clutch, aligning the missing internal spline of the clutch with the key in the mainshaft ( Figure 144).

figure.caption: Figure 144. Install 6th and 7th Speed Sliding Clutch

step1.para: Place mainshaft assembly on a bench. Remove the snap ring from the rear of the 2nd speed gear. Install 2nd speed gear on the rear of the mainshaft engaging 2nd and 3rd speed clutch ( Figure 145).

figure.caption: Figure 145. Install 2nd Speed Gear
